channel.title: Automation Tools :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Okta Automation Tools Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal application builders Page type: Navigation Content type: Autogenerated Index An autogenerated index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs.

item.title: Okta Workflows
item.description: Okta Workflows Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal application builders Description: A developer’s introduction to Okta Workflows, what it is for, what problems it solves, and how developers write code against it (if at all). Are there any connections with SCIM and LCM applications and therefore the OIN for example? Also, make sure to compare and contrast with Connector Builder and Hooks.

item.title: Workflow Connector Builder
item.description: Workflow Connector Builder Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal application builders Description: A brief introduction to Workflows Connector Builder that distinguishes it from Okta Workflows the Platform and what hooks are for. Note that WCB can create flows that can also be submitted to OIN. Then redirect to the help doc area.

item.title: Hooks
item.description: Inline and Event Hooks Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal application builders Description: An overview of event and inline hooks, what they are, and some basic use cases. Establish the difference between hooks and the Workflows platform, and then provide a link to the more detailed “How to Implement a hook section” (ID: 660)
